original: NILSON, Ernst Samuel, Direktör, Stockholm, f Sthlm 20/3 85 av åkeriäg E N o Clara Andreasdtr, gm Alma Christiansen. Hdlsinst, språkstud Engl. Anst fad fma, etabl eg åkeri-fma 06, start automobilfma Ernst Nilson & Co 19, omb denna t AB 22, vkst dir f detta, ordf Sv Ford-hand.frn, överg t Volvo-märken 42. Styr.ordf Kgl Lawntennis Klb samt i Fastigh.AB o AB A Wiklund. Adjut o kårch FAK, und n år, delt i motortävl fr 11, däribl ett 10-tal av KAK st vintertävl. RVO.
translated: NILSON, Ernst Samuel, Director, Stockholm, b. Stockholm 20/3 85, son of farmer E N and Clara Andreasdtr, m. Alma Christiansen. Business education, language studies in English. Employed by his father's company, established own trucking company in 1906, started automobile company Ernst Nilson & Co in 1919, transformed it into a limited company (AB) in 1922, became managing director of the company and chairman of the Swedish Ford Dealers Association in 1942. Also served as chairman of the Royal Lawn Tennis Club and in the boards of Fastigh.AB and AB A Wiklund. Adjutant and major in the Swedish Military Intelligence Service, participated in motor races since 1911, including numerous winter races organized by the Swedish Automobile Sports Club. Awarded the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).

structured.name: Ernst Samuel Nilson
structured.description: Director from Stockholm, Ernst Samuel Nilson was born on March 20, 1885. He was the son of E N and Clara Andreasdtr. He married Alma Christiansen. He received a business education and studied language in English. He worked at his father's company and later established his own trucking company in 1906. In 1919, he started an automobile company called Ernst Nilson & Co, which was transformed into a limited company (AB) in 1922. From 1942, he served as the managing director of the company and also became the chairman of the Swedish Ford Dealers Association. Ernst Nilson was actively involved in various organizations such as the Royal Lawn Tennis Club, Fastigh.AB, and AB A Wiklund. He held the rank of Adjutant and major in the Swedish Military Intelligence Service. He participated in motor races, including several winter races organized by the Swedish Automobile Sports Club. Ernst Nilson was honored with the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).

career.workplace: Ernst Nilson & Co (later transformed into AB)
